text: <@U054MT9FC>:  the widget ones look hot af
<@U054MT9FC> nice.

They all look amazing, but I would put those widgets in the 2nd spot because that's an important feature. Then I would also put the black ones at the end, but that might just be me because I dislike black apps :wink:
This joke is in the UI Kit I'm using :stuck_out_tongue: <https://i.imgur.com/yKnLXEg.png>
:disappointed:
So I'm a bit at loss on how the display the store's information, this is the current mockup: <https://i.imgur.com/IDbonss.png>
I was thinking of making the 'Open today' expand when clicking on it to show the opening hours. I still need to add some way of 'hearting' the store.
I feel like the transparent toolbar is only cool if you have no action items. They tend to get lost in some cases
I was thinking of a FAB of course, but the other person that works on iOS dislikes that.
(But he is against a lot of Material Design)
<@U04TK850N>: I was also thinking of adding another call to action to show the inventory of the store.
To get around that, but still keep the top right icon.
I also plan to make the collapsable toolbarlayout smaller.
What is this app for <@U061HDV96> ?
<http://www.lunchbreakapp.be> I'm redesigning everything right now for Android.

attachments.title: Lunchbreak, wacht niet langer.
attachments.text: Genoeg gehad van die lange wachtrijen bij het halen van je eten? Gebruik Lunchbreak en besteed je tijd aan wat belangrijk is! - Binnenkort in de App Store en Google Play Store.

text: It's in Dutch I'm afraid, we haven't gotten around to multi language support.
Google translate handles most of that :wink:
For me
It's a service for butchers, bakeries, trendy bars.. to offer take away orders.
Testing starts June 21st.
Gotcha
With 2 stores (1 store out of the original 3 is on vacation)
We plan to make it like Slack: you download the app and you can get going.
All the store needs is an iPad running iOS 8 (currently, we'll try to lower this soon, but this is easier for us to not worry during development)
Have a lot of customers running less than iOS 8?
That's only for the store app. The only iPad that doesn't support iOS 8 is the iPad 1.
The app for the end user is iOS 7 and Android 4.0+
<@U04TK850N>: This is better? <https://i.imgur.com/nRpx5Nx.jpg>
I'd put the hearts somewhere more visible
they barely are on that background
or maybe throw a shadow or something behind them to make them pop
you could maybe bring them down into keyline
Keyline?
<@U04Q15WNR>: I'll do that
yeah your text is aligned to the keyline
if you bring it there just above everything else you can’t miss it and that wont take away from the picture
So you mean to put it next to the X button or a bit more to the left?
Noob alert! What is a keyline?
are we talking just art principles
or is it material design specific?
material design
I get what it is now, I was thinking something different because if you translate that to Dutch, it has a different meaning (at least that's what popped into my head at first)
<https://www.google.com/design/spec/layout/metrics-keylines.html>

text: Haha, I don't like it either.
Does setting the ColorFilter on a Drawable affect its appearance everywhere? Cause I have no other explanation for what I'm seeing in my app.
yup, it does
you can use yourDrawable.mutate() to get an actually different copy
otherwise Drawable from resources "share" a state
<@U04TK850N>: thanks for the tip :smile:

<@U04TK850N>: for some reason the following doesn't fix the issue:
```ImageView heartImage = (ImageView) holder.itemView.findViewById(R.id.storeHeartImage);
Drawable heartIcon = heartImage.getDrawable().mutate();
heartIcon.setColorFilter(red, PorterDuff.Mode.MULTIPLY);
heartImage.setImageDrawable(heartIcon);```
Ah I'm looking at the mutate method and I get why perhaps.
And I'm wrong...
Hm, I don’t see what would be wrong with that
It fits what’s done here: <http://android-developers.blogspot.de/2009/05/drawable-mutations.html>
